DOC.brief_summary: Use oral clarithromycin treatment chronic lung disease due Mycobacterium avium-intracellulare non-tuberculous Mycobacteria
DOC.brief_title: Clarithromycin Treatment Infections Caused Nontuberculous Mycobacteria ( NTM )
DOC.criteria: Meet American Thoracic Society criterion nontuberculous lung disease : two AFB smear positive , culture positive sputum bronchoscopic sample and/or two AFB smear negative respiratory sample moderate heavy growth ( 2+4+ ) ; abnormal CXR consistent M. avium lung disease ; absence potential lung pathogen ( except coexistence M. abscessus ) Age 18 year old History macrolide allergy Must receive antihistamine terfenadine ( Seldane ) astemizole ( Hismanal ) clarithromycin Children le 18 year age If menstruating female , pregnant adequate birth control
